methods.getOrderForColumn:
**Incompatible overloads text - text from the first overload:**

Retrieve the sorting order for a column from a table.

*Overload 1*  
  :param attribute: (java.lang.String) - the Table's value of Table.SORTED_COLUMNS_ATTRIBUTE.
  :param columnName: (java.lang.String) - the name of the column
  :return: (java.util.Optional<io.deephaven.engine.table.impl.SortingOrder>) an optional containing the SortingOrder of the column if defined, empty otherwise
  
*Overload 2*  
  :param table: (io.deephaven.engine.table.Table) - the table to interrogate
  :param columnName: (java.lang.String) - the name of the column
  :return: (java.util.Optional<io.deephaven.engine.table.impl.SortingOrder>) an optional containing the SortingOrder of the column if defined, empty otherwise
methods.isSortedBy:
Determine if a table is sorted by the given column and order.

:param table: (io.deephaven.engine.table.Table) - the table to interrogate
:param columnName: (java.lang.String) - the name of the column
:param order: (io.deephaven.engine.table.impl.SortingOrder) - the order to check for
:return: (boolean) true if table is sorted by columnName in the specified order
methods.setOrderForColumn:
**Incompatible overloads text - text from the first overload:**

Mark the table as sorted by the given column.

*Overload 1*  
  :param attribute: (java.lang.String) - an attribute containing sorting order
  :param columnName: (java.lang.String) - the column to update
  :param order: (io.deephaven.engine.table.impl.SortingOrder) - the order that the column is sorted in
  :return: (java.lang.String) a String suitable for use as a Table.SORTED_COLUMNS_ATTRIBUTE value.
  
*Overload 2*  
  :param table: (io.deephaven.engine.table.Table) - the table to update
  :param columnName: (java.lang.String) - the column to update
  :param order: (io.deephaven.engine.table.impl.SortingOrder) - the order that the column is sorted in

text: Helper class for managing the sorted columns attribute.
